flawed_nl_solution:
1/6 * 240 students = <<1/6*240=40>>40 students. So 40 students read three or more novels.
7/20 * 240 students = <<7/20*240=84>>84 students. So 84 students read two novels.
5/12 * 240 students = <<5/12*240=576>>576 students. So 576 students read a novel.
240 students - (40 students + 84 students + 576 students) = 240 students - {students_three_or_more + students_two_novels + students_one_novel} students = <<240-(40+84+576)=-460>>-460 students. So -460 students don't read novels.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 576. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
